alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 5:44AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...AN INTENSE BAND OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF JEFFERSON, OSWEGO, AND LEWIS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of very heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing very heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heart of the band, with up to 4 inches per hour locally, especially from the Adams and Adams Center areas extending inland across the Tug Hill. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 540 AM EST, an intense band of lake effect snow was located from just north of Mannsville to just north of Adams Center and extending inland across the Tug Hill. This band will continue to very slowly progress northward through the early morning hours and will impact the Watertown area morning commute. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... South Watertown, Stony Point, Adams, Redfield, Adams Center, Henderson Harbor, Barnes Corners, Southwick Beach State Park, Sackets Harbor, Henderson, Smithville, Rodman, Orwell, Lorraine, Sandy Creek, Lacona, Mannsville, Ellisburg, Worth, and East Rodman. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 37 and 44. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
